-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


@package plutarch-orphanage
@version 1.0.3

module PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils

-- | Helper for <a>ByteString</a>s of a fixed length. We don't expose the
--   constructor, instead providing a read-only pattern, as well as an
--   accessor function, to ensure that the size invariant is maintained.
data SizedByteString (n :: Natural)

-- | Read-only pattern for accessing the underlying <a>ByteString</a>. Use
--   it just like you would use a data constructor in a pattern match.
pattern SizedByteString :: forall (n :: Natural). ByteString -> SizedByteString n

-- | Get the underlying <a>ByteString</a>. It is guaranteed to have the
--   length specified in its type.
unSizedByteString :: forall (n :: Natural). SizedByteString n -> ByteString

-- | Plutus' ledger API often has to 'fake' <a>Word64</a> using the much
--   larger <a>Integer</a> type. This helper is designed to generate
--   <a>Integer</a>s that fit into <a>Word64</a>.
--   
--   We don't expose the constructor directly; instead, we provide a
--   read-only pattern and an accessor function.
data AsWord64

-- | Read-only pattern for accessing the underlying <a>Integer</a>. Use it
--   just like you would use a data constructor in a pattern match.
pattern AsWord64 :: Integer -> AsWord64

fromAsWord64 :: AsWord64 -> Integer
instance GHC.Show.Show (PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.SizedByteString n)
instance GHC.Classes.Ord (PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.SizedByteString n)
instance GHC.Classes.Eq (PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.SizedByteString n)
instance GHC.Show.Show PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.AsWord64
instance Test.QuickCheck.Arbitrary.CoArbitrary PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.AsWord64
instance Test.QuickCheck.Arbitrary.Arbitrary PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.AsWord64
instance GHC.Classes.Ord PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.AsWord64
instance GHC.Classes.Eq PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.AsWord64
instance Test.QuickCheck.Arbitrary.CoArbitrary (PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.SizedByteString n)
instance Test.QuickCheck.Function.Function PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.AsWord64
instance GHC.TypeNats.KnownNat n => Test.QuickCheck.Arbitrary.Arbitrary (PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.SizedByteString n)
instance Test.QuickCheck.Function.Function (PlutusLedgerApi.QuickCheck.Utils.SizedByteString n)

module PlutusLedgerApi.V1.Orphans

-- | @since WIP
data UnsortedAssocMap k v

-- | @since WIP
getUnsortedAssocMap :: UnsortedAssocMap k v -> Map k v
instance Test.QuickCheck.Arbitrary.Arbitrary PlutusLedgerApi.V1.Contexts.ScriptContext
instance Test.QuickCheck.Arbitrary.CoArbitrary PlutusLedgerApi.V1.Contexts.ScriptContext
instance Test.QuickCheck.Function.Function PlutusLedgerApi.V1.Contexts.ScriptContext


-- | QuickCheck orphans (plus a few helpers) for V2 Plutus ledger API
--   types.
module PlutusLedgerApi.V2.Orphans

-- | A <a>Value</a> that contains zero Ada.
--   
--   <h1>Note</h1>
--   
--   This is designed to act as a modifier, and thus, we expose the
--   constructor even though it preserves invariants. If you use the
--   constructor directly, be <i>very</i> certain that the Value being
--   wrapped satisfies the invariants described above: failing to do so
--   means all guarantees of this type are off the table.
newtype NonAdaValue
NonAdaValue :: Value -> NonAdaValue

getNonAdaValue :: NonAdaValue -> Value

-- | A <a>Value</a> suitable for <a>TxOut</a>. Specifically:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The <a>Value</a> is sorted by both keys (meaning
--   <a>CurrencySymbol</a> and <a>TokenName</a>);</li>
--   <li>There exists an Ada amount; and</li>
--   <li>All amounts are positive.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <h1>Note</h1>
--   
--   This is designed to act as a modifier, and thus, we expose the
--   constructor even though it preserves invariants. If you use the
--   constructor directly, be <i>very</i> certain that the Value being
--   wrapped satisfies the invariants described above: failing to do so
--   means all guarantees of this type are off the table.
newtype UTxOValue
UTxOValue :: Value -> UTxOValue

getUtxoValue :: UTxOValue -> Value

-- | A <a>Value</a> containing only Ada, suitable for fees. Furthermore,
--   the Ada quantity is positive.
--   
--   <h1>Note</h1>
--   
--   This is designed to act as a modifier, and thus, we expose the
--   constructor even though it preserves invariants. If you use the
--   constructor directly, be <i>very</i> certain that the Value being
--   wrapped satisfies the invariants described above: failing to do so
--   means all guarantees of this type are off the table.
newtype FeeValue
FeeValue :: Value -> FeeValue

getFeeValue :: FeeValue -> Value
instance Test.QuickCheck.Arbitrary.Arbitrary PlutusLedgerApi.V1.Bytes.LedgerBytes
instance Test.QuickCheck.Arbitrary.CoArbitrary PlutusLedgerApi.V1.Bytes.LedgerBytes
instance Test.QuickCheck.Function.Function PlutusLedgerApi.V1.Bytes.LedgerBytes
